results.name: Number of permutations of (1,2,3,...,n) where each of the (n-1) adjacent pairs of elements sums to a prime.
comment: The number of Hamiltonian paths in a graph of which the nodes represent the numbers (1,2,3,...,n) and the edges connect each pair of nodes that add up to a prime. - _Bob Andriesse_, Oct 04 2020
example: For n = 5, we have the 4 permutations and the sums of adjacent elements:
program: a(n) = {nbok = 0; for (j=1, n!, perm = numtoperm(n, j); if (okperm(perm), nbok++);); return (nbok);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 08 2013
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 30 2005
